title: DevOps Intern - USA-MA-Boston
text: InternYour Role:Xamarin’s mission is to create the most compelling developer tools on the planet. We’re searching for a talented DevOps Intern to join the Release Engineering team.Maybe you’ve done some development or even created an app or two. Or, you have built your own computer from spare parts and are eager to polish your scripting and coding skills. Either way, you love both, and you want to grow your knowledge by tackling bigger challenges.Who broke the build? We’ll know immediately because the continuous integration process that you help setup has already kicked off an email, turned on the red lava lamp, and fired a foam missile from a USB launcher in the direction of the responsible engineer. Got data? You should love collecting log files, graphing metrics, and analyzing the data to spot trends in the quality of our workflow and processes, and generally, be a data junkie.Key Responsibilities:Maintaining our growing fleet of Mac and Windows build bots. This may include tasks such as tracking of system updates, creating and deploying new system images, and being responsible for handling bot change requests from the development teams.Releasing and publishing our products based off of QA and Project Management approval.Writing scripts to automate tasks that are currently done manually. This may include tasks such as handling scheduled backups, collecting load metrics from our build bots, etc.Contributing code to the growing list of metrics that we collect, and then helping to devise visualizations and other reporting means to surface that data to the rest of the company.Balancing today’s work while making improvements for the future.Other tasks as assigned by direct manager.What We're Looking For:Programming experience in Ruby, Javascript/Node.JS or similar programming languages.DVCS experience, Git preferredExperience with data visualization (d3, Google Charts, others) and analysisIntellectual curiosity that motivates you to keep on top of technical trendsDemonstrated initiative, flexibility and ability to concurrently manage multiple deadline-driven tasks and projects; self-starterExcellent team player, including the ability to work cross functionally in a fast paced environmentBonus:Contributed to open source projects and can share code samples via Github or other source code hosting facility, send your Github link!Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment tools (Jenkins, TeamCity or similar)Experience managing installations of 50 Mac and Windows machines Company info
